At normal retirement date each member will be entitled to receive a monthly retirement equal to two percent of his average monthly earnings during the highest consecutive five of the last ten years of service before his retirement date multiplied by his years of service subject to a maximum of 25 years. Fractional credit is given for completed months of service. 
b.  If an optional retirement date shall have been elected with respect to a member, the amount of the monthly payments on the normal annuity form commencing at the optional retirement date shall be equal to the actuarial equivalent of the amount of monthly payments on the normal annuity form commencing at the normal retirement date to which the member would have been entitled under [sub]section a above. If an optional annuity form shall have been elected with respect to a member, the amount of the monthly payments thereunder shall be equal to the actuarial equivalent of the amount of monthly payments that would otherwise have been payable on the normal annuity form commencing at the same retirement date. 
Section 8. - Contributions. 
    Each member will make a monthly contribution during an accounting year by payroll deduction of an amount equal to seven percent of his monthly earnings in effect at the beginning of that accounting year. 
    Member contributions shall be paid to the insurance carrier. 
    Contributions by the trustees pursuant to this plan shall be paid to the insurance carrier under the contract, and such contributions will be accumulated on a deposit administration basis under such contract. Under such contract, the insurance carrier does not guarantee the adequacy of the accumulation to provide the plan benefits. 
    The insurance carrier's liability with respect to a member shall apply only to the member's contributions and to the retirement income actually provided under the contract. 
    A member's contributions and accrual of retirement benefits to such member shall cease at such member's normal retirement date, even though such member may continue to be employed after such date. 
Section 9. - Form of retirement income. 
a.  The normal form of retirement income is a modified cash refund annuity, which provides monthly payments to the member beginning at his retirement date and ending with the last monthly payment due before his death, and, at the member's death after his retirement date, a single sum payment to the beneficiary designated to receive such payment of an amount equal to the excess, if any, of the member's contributions, with credited interest to his retirement date, over the sum of all the annuity payments that have become due to him. 
b.  Optional annuity form. Subject to the conditions and restrictions set forth in paragraph 2 below, a member may elect to have his annuity benefit payable on one of the optional annuity forms set forth in paragraph 1 below in lieu of on the normal annuity form. 
1.  Forms described. 
(a)  Joint and survivor annuity. The Joint and Survivor Annuity form provides monthly payments beginning at the member's retirement date and ending with the last monthly payment due before the death of the survivor of the member and his joint annuitant, and, upon receipt of due proof of such death, a single sum payment to the beneficiary designated to receive such payment of an amount equal to the excess, if any, of the member's contributions, with credited interest to his retirement date, over the sum of all the annuity payments that have become due under this contract with respect to the member. Monthly payments shall be made to the member, while living, and, after his death, to his joint annuitant, if living. The amount of each monthly payment to the joint annuitant shall be a percentage, designated by the member, of the monthly annuity payment to the member. 
(b)  Life annuity - 10 years certain. The Life Annuity - 10 Years Certain form provides monthly payments beginning at the member's retirement date, provided [that] he is then living, and ending with the last monthly payment due before his death or the end of the certain period, whichever is later. Payments will be made to the member, while living, and, after his death, any annuity payments becoming due will be made to the beneficiary authorized to receive such payments in accordance with article XIII. The certain period is a period of 120 months beginning at the member's retirement date. 
2.  Conditions and restrictions. The member shall file his election of the optional form with the trustees before his retirement date. Evidence satisfactory to the trustees of the good health of the member at the time he files his election of the optional annuity form shall be required unless such election is filed at least two years before the member's retirement date. If the election of an optional annuity form would result in monthly payments to any person of less than $5.00 each, such election shall not become operative except upon the specific consent in writing of the trustees. If the member dies before his retirement date, the election of the optional annuity form shall not be effective. If the optional retirement date is elected, the optional annuity form is subject to modification as provided in Section 6b(2), without the consent of the joint annuitant or beneficiary. If the Life Annuity - 10 Years Certain form is elected, the member may not revoke such election without the written consent of the trustees unless such revocation is made at least two years before the member's retirement date. If the Joint and Survivor Annuity form is elected, the following conditions and restrictions shall also apply: 
(a)  The member is to designate, on the blank on which the optional annuity form is elected, his joint annuitant and the percentage (not to exceed 100 percent) of the monthly annuity payments to the member to be continued to the joint annuitant. The designation of any person as joint annuitant shall not constitute such person a beneficiary with respect to any other benefit provided under this plan. 
(b)  Proof satisfactory to the trustees of the age of the joint annuitant shall be furnished within 90 days after the trustees receive the election of the optional annuity form, but in no event later than the member's retirement date. 
(c)  If the joint annuitant dies before the member's retirement date, the election of the optional annuity form shall not be effective. 
(d)  The member may not revoke his election of the optional annuity form nor change the designated joint annuitant or the amount payable to the joint annuitant without the written consent of the trustees, unless such revocation or change is made at least two years before the member's retirement date. 
Section 10. - Termination of employment and termination of membership in plan. 
a.  In the event of termination of a member's service before retirement date and before the completion of ten years of service, a member may elect, any time before his retirement date to receive: 
1.  A return of all his contributions, plus credited interest; or 
2.  An annuity payable at his retirement date based solely on his own contributions. 
b.  In the event of termination of a member's service before his retirement date and after completion of ten years of service, the member shall receive at his retirement date an annuity based on his service to the date of termination of employment unless the member elects to receive a return of his contributions plus interest at any time before his retirement date. 
Section 11. - Authorized leave of absence. 
    An employee's employment shall not be considered terminated while such employee is on an authorized leave of absence. 
Section 12. - Death benefits. 
    A member's total contribution's with credited interest will be paid to his beneficiary in a lump sum in the event of his death prior to his retirement date. If a member who has elected to defer commencement of his annuity payments dies after normal retirement date but before his deferred commencement date, his total contributions, with interest to date of death, will be paid to his beneficiary, unless an optional annuity form is in effect with respect to the member, in which case annuity payments shall be made as described in Section 6b. 
Section 13. - Widow's benefits. 
a.  In the event of the death, in the line of duty and prior to retirement, termination date or the date of commencement of disability income payments, of a male member, his widow shall be entitled to receive a monthly income equal to 50 percent of his average monthly earnings during the five-year period (or less) immediately preceding his death. (This benefit is in addition to the single sum payment equal to his own contributions made under the plan with appropriate interest as described in Section 12.) 
b.  Upon the death, in the line of duty, of a male member who deferred his retirement under the provisions of Section 6c, and has not elected an optional form of retirement income, his widow shall be entitled to receive a monthly benefit equal to 50 percent of the monthly benefit to which the member is entitled to as of the date of his death. 
c.  The widow's benefit shall commence on the first day of the month following the month in which the member's death occurs. The last payment shall be made on the earlier of the first day of the month in which the widow's death occurs or the first day of the month in which her remarriage occurs. 
d.  In the event of the death of a widow who is receiving benefits in accordance with the provisions of this Section 13, her child or children as a group, if any, shall be entitled to receive a monthly amount equal to the widow's benefit that was being paid monthly to the widow at the time of her death. Such payment shall be paid to whoever is responsible for the support of such child or children. 
e.  Benefits payable to a child under this article shall commence on the first day of the month next following the month in which the widow's death occurs, and shall cease on the first day of the month in which the earlier of the child's death or 18th birthday occurs. Such benefit will continue to be paid in the case of a group until no eligible children remain. 
Section 14. - Disability retirement benefits. 
a.  Nonduty caused. An active member, who while in the active service of the employer and after he has completed ten years of service, becomes in the judgment of the trustees, totally and permanently disabled, shall be entitled to receive a monthly disability benefit continuing during such disability in an amount equal to two percent of his average monthly earnings during the five-year period immediately preceding the date of disability for each year of service to date, subject to a maximum of 25 years of service. 
    Duty caused. An active member, who while in the active service of the employer becomes, in the judgment of the trustees, totally and permanently disabled in the line of duty, shall be entitled to receive a monthly disability benefit continuing during such disability in an amount equal to 50 percent of his average monthly earnings during the five-year period (or less) preceding the date of disability. 
b.  [Required proof of total disability.] The trustees shall have the right at any time to require proof of the continuation of total disability, including an examination of the member by the employer's medical representatives. 
c.  [Cessation of benefits.] Disability retirement benefits shall cease upon the earliest of, (1) the member's recovery from disability, in which case he shall be considered to have terminated service as of the date of recovery unless he re-enters the service of the employer, or (2) the date of the member's death, or (3) the member's retirement date at which time the member will receive a retirement annuity equal to the amount of disability benefit that he had been receiving. 
Section 15. - Beneficiary. 
    A member may designate a beneficiary (with the right to change such designation), to receive any payment or payments to which a beneficiary may become entitled under this plan. Any other person to whom periodic payments are payable under this plan may designate (with the right to change such designation) a beneficiary to receive any single sum payment or any remaining periodic payments becoming due upon the death of such person, if no prior designation is in effect with respect thereto. 
    If no designated beneficiary is surviving when a payment becomes payable to a beneficiary, any single sum payment or the commuted value of any monthly payments payable to a beneficiary shall be made to the person or persons in the first then surviving class of the following classes of successive preference beneficiaries: 
(a)  The member's widow or widower; 
(b)  The member's surviving children; 
(c)  The member's surviving parents; 
(d)  The member's surviving brothers and sisters; or 
(e)  The executors or administrators of the person upon whose death the payment becomes payable to a beneficiary. 
    In the absence of a duly appointed guardian, any minor's share may be paid at a rate not exceeding $50.00 per month to such adult or adults as, in the opinion of the insurance carrier, have assumed the custody and principal support of the minor. 
Section 16. - Small retirement incomes. 
    If the retirement income to which any member becomes entitled should be less than $5.00 per month, the member may be paid, in lieu of such income, a lump sum cash payment actuarially equivalent to such retirement income. 
    If periodic payments to any person would be less than $20.00 per month, the insurance carrier may pay at such intervals as will make each payment at least $20.00. 
Section 17. - Nonalienation of benefits. 
    No sum payable with respect to a member may be assigned, commuted, or encumbered by the payee, and, to the extent permitted by law, no such sum shall in any way be subject to any legal process to subject the same to the payment of any claim against such payee. 
Section 18. - Amendment or termination of the plan. 
a.  While the employer expects to continue the plan and payment of contributions hereunder indefinitely, the right to amend or terminate the plan is necessarily reserved to the employer together with the right to discontinue, suspend or change the rate and amount of its contributions at any time. However, no such action shall cause any part of the corpus or income of the plan to be used for, or diverted to purposes other than the exclusive benefit of the members, nor shall any such action adversely affect the retirement income already provided under the contract. 
b.  In the event of discontinuance of the plan, the contributions made by the employer will remain for the exclusive benefit of members under the plan. In the event of the termination of the plan the fund, to the extent sufficient therefor, shall be allocated toward providing retirement benefits herein for members in the following order of precedence, based on service to the date of termination: 
1.  To provide retirement benefits for members who had reached their normal retirement date but had not retired on the date of termination; 
2.  To provide retirement benefits for members who were eligible for early retirement but had not retired on the date of termination of the plan; 
3.  To provide retirement benefits for members who would have been eligible for retirement benefits if their employment had been terminated on the date of termination of the plan; 
4.  To provide retirement benefits for all other members on the basis of years of service to the date of termination. 
If the balance remaining for allocation under any of the foregoing paragraphs is insufficient to provide in full the allocations under such paragraphs, allocations to individual members under such paragraph shall be reduced prorata and no allocations shall be made under subsequent paragraphs. 
    After all of the foregoing allocations have been made, any amounts remaining shall be returned to the employer. 
Section 19. - General provisions. 
    Each member entitled to benefits under the plan shall furnish to the trustees such evidence, data or information as the trustees consider necessary or desirable in order to properly administer the plan. 
    Each member included under the plan will receive a certificate issued by the insurance carrier when he becomes a member of the plan. At the time of retirement, each retired member will receive from the insurance carrier a supplemental certificate outlining the amount of annuity and the conditions of payment. 
    The provisions of the group annuity contract shall govern with respect to the rights and obligations of the insurance carrier, notwithstanding any contrary provisions of the plan. 
    This plan is contingent upon and subject to obtaining such approval of the commissioner of internal revenue as may be necessary to establish qualification of the plan. 
Section 20. - Management and policy direction. 
    The plan created by this ordinance shall be construed to be a trust separate and distinct from all other entities. The responsibility for the direction and operation of the plan and for making effective the provisions hereof are hereby vested in the trustees and the Governing Body of the City. 
CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 6 

Section 1. - [Retirement income plan; exemption from state constitution and state law provisions; substitute and additional provisions.] 
    That pursuant to the provisions of Section 5(c) of article 12 of the Constitution of the State of Kansas, the City of Pittsburg, Kansas, hereby elects that K.S.A. 13-14a06 shall not apply to said City and provides the following substitute and additional provisions on the same subject: 
    All present members of the police and Fire Department who are enrolled and who become members of the retirement income plan of the City of Pittsburg, Kansas, under Charter Ordinance No. 5 shall be entitled to be paid by the City the total amount of the deductions from his salary paid into the police or Fire Department pension funds, less 50 percent; that any members of the police and Fire Department who enrolls and becomes a member under the retirement income plan for police and fire personnel shall not be considered to have been terminated from the police or Fire Department and shall be credited under the retirement income plan for prior service as a policeman or fireman.

CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 9 

Section 1. - [Public improvements; exemption from state constitution and state law provisions.] 
    The City of Pittsburg, Kansas, a commission-manager City of the first class, by the power invested in it by article 12, Section 5 of the Constitution of the State of Kansas, hereby elects to and exempts itself from, and makes inapplicable to it, K.S.A. 13-1017 which applies only to cities of the first class and applying to said City, and to provide substitute and additional provisions as hereinafter provided. 
Section 2. - [Cost estimates; contracts.] 
    Before undertaking the construction or reconstruction of any sidewalk, curb, gutter, bridge, pavement, sewer or any other public improvements in any street, highway or public grounds, or on any public building or facility, or any other kind of public improvement which is to be financed by the issuance of bonds shall be commenced or ordered by the Governing Body or under its authority, a detailed estimate of the cost of such improvements shall be made under oath by the City Engineer (or some other competent person, appointed for such purposes by the Governing Body), and said estimate shall be submitted to the Governing Body for its action thereon; and in all cases where the estimated cost of the contemplated building or public improvement amounts to more than $2,000.00, the Governing Body shall, by resolution, determine whether the work can best be accomplished by City forces or by contract. If the work is to be done other than by City forces, sealed proposals for the building or construction thereof shall be invited by advertisement published by the City Clerk in the official City paper for at least three consecutive days, and the Governing Body shall let all such work by contract to the lowest responsible bidder, if there be any such whose bid does not exceed the estimate. 
    If no responsible person shall propose to enter into the contract at a price not exceeding the estimated cost, all bids shall be rejected; however, the Governing Body shall have power to make said improvement within the estimated cost thereof, and in addition, may purchase the necessary labor, construct the necessary plant or plants for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of this act. In no case shall the City be liable for anything beyond the estimated cost or the original contract price for doing such work or making such improvements. 
    Before any type of public improvements shall be commenced, the money to pay for the same must be available in the City treasury as provided by law; or provision may be made for the issuance of internal improvement bonds to pay for any such improvement as provided by law; provided that this Section shall not be construed to include any repair or maintenance work not amounting to substantial alteration, addition or change in any structure, street or facility; and "public improvement" as used herein shall not include the making of repairs or the maintenance of any building, street, sidewalk or other public facility by employees of the City or the making of any expenditures from the City budget for such purposes.

CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 17 

Section 1. - [Consumption of alcoholic liquor on public premises in the Memorial Auditorium; exemption from state constitution and state law provisions.] 
    The City of Pittsburg, Kansas, hereby elects to and does exempt itself from the provisions of K.S.A. 41-719 pursuant to article 12, Section 5 of the Kansas Constitution. 
Section 2. - [Additional and substitute provisions.] 
    The City of Pittsburg, Kansas, in lieu thereof, hereby provides additional and substitute provisions on the same subject as follows: 
a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to drink or consume alcoholic liquor upon the public streets, alleys, roads or highways, or in beer parlors, taverns, pool halls, or places to which the general public has access, whether or not an admission or other fee is charged or collected, or upon property owned by the state or any governmental subdivision thereof, or inside vehicles while upon the public streets, alleys, roads, or highways; provided, however, [that] the aforesaid limitations shall not apply to real property leased by the City to others under the provisions of K.S.A. 12-1740-12-1749 inclusive, and any amendments thereto, if such real property is actually being used for hotel or motel purposes or purposes incidental thereto; nor shall said limitations apply to any state owned or operated building or structure and the surrounding premises which are furnished to or occupied by any state officer or employee as a residence; nor shall said limitations apply to the drinking or consumption of alcoholic liquor in the Memorial Auditorium. 
b)  Any person violating the provisions of this Section shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction, shall be punished by a fine of not less than $50.00 nor more than $200.00, or by a term of imprisonment not to exceed six months, or by both such fine and imprisonment.

CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 19 

Section 1. - [Meetings of Governing Body; exemption from state constitution and state law provisions.] 
    The City of Pittsburg, Kansas, hereby elects to and does exempt itself from the provisions of K.S.A. 12-1009 pursuant to article 12, Section 5 of the Kansas Constitution. 
Section 2. - [Meeting days.] 
    The Governing Body of the City of Pittsburg, Kansas, shall meet on the second and fourth Tuesdays of every month or more often if the public business requires. Regular and special meetings shall always be open to the public. 
Section 3. - [Regular and special meetings.] 
    That the regular meetings shall be held on second and fourth Tuesdays of each month at 7:00 o'clock p.m.; however, the Governing Body shall have the right by ordinary ordinance to set a different time of such regular meetings and hold special meetings when required. 
Section 4. - [Repeal of Charter Ordinances 7 and S-671.] 
    Charter Ordinance No. 7 and Ordinance No. S-671 are hereby repealed.

Section 1. - [Assessment of costs in municipal court; exemption from state constitution and state law provisions.]

CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 23

CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 24 

Section 1. - [Water and sewer system; exemption from state law provisions; substitute and additional provisions.] 
    Pursuant to the constitution, the City of Pittsburg, Kansas, hereby elects that parts of K.S.A. 12-862 of the Act shall not apply to said City and provides the following substitute and additional provisions on the same subject: 
"The Governing Body of the City, by a two-thirds vote of the members thereof may contract for and make repairs, alterations, extensions, reconstructions, enlargements or improvements of its water and sewage system and issue or cause to be issued revenue bonds in payment of the cost thereof without submitting to a vote of the electors of such City the proposal to contract for or to make such repairs, alterations, extensions, reconstructions, enlargements or improvements and to issue such bonds in payment of the cost thereof; provided, that the Governing Body or other proper officers of any such City shall, before contracting for or making any such repairs, extensions, reconstructions, enlargements or improvements, cause to be published in the official paper of said City a notice of its intention so to do which notice shall describe the nature of the proposed repair, alteration, reconstruction, enlargement or improvement, state the total amount of the cost thereof and the amount of the bonds to be issued for the payment thereof. If, within 15 days after the publication as aforesaid of such notice, there shall be filed with the clerk of such City a written protest against such proposed repairs, alterations, extensions, reconstructions, enlargements or improvements and such bond issue, signed by not less than 20 percent of the qualified electors of such City, the Governing Body of such City shall thereupon submit such proposed project and the proposed bond issue to the electors of such City at an election to be called for such purpose and held within 90 days after the last publication of the City's notice of its intention to complete the proposed project and issue the proposed bonds. In the event that a majority of such voters voting on such proposition at such election shall vote in favor thereof, such repairs, alternations, extensions, reconstructions, enlargements or improvements may be made and such bonds may be issued in payment of the cost thereof. All bonds issued hereunder shall be revenue bonds and such bonds are hereby made a lien on the revenues produced from the water and sewage system, but shall not be general obligations of the City and shall not contain the recital set forth in K.S.A. 10-112 and amendments thereof, but shall contain recitals stating that they are issued in conformity with the provisions, restrictions and limitations of this act, that such bonds and the interest thereon are to be paid by the issuing City from the revenues derived from the rates and charges herein mentioned and not from any other fund or source, that the same have been registered in the Office of the City Clerk of the issuing City and the treasurer of the State of Kansas, respectively, and that said bonds are negotiable. All such bonds, when registered and issued, as herein provided, shall import absolute verity and shall be conclusive in favor of all persons purchasing such bonds that all proceedings and conditions precedent have been had and performed to authorize the issuance thereof and such bonds shall be negotiable." 
Section 2. - [General obligation bonds; exemption from state law provisions; substitute and additional provisions.] 
    Pursuant to the constitution, the City of Pittsburg, Kansas, hereby elects that parts of K.S.A. 12-863 of the Act shall not apply to said City and provides the following substitute and additional provisions on the same subject: 
"Any City which has issued revenue bonds under the provisions of K.S.A. 12-862 may from time to time issue general obligation bonds under the provisions of K.S.A. 10-427a, as amended, to refund any previous issue or part thereof of its outstanding revenue bonds, including the principal amount thereof and all accrued interest thereon to the date of either the maturity or redemption thereof together with any redemption premium. Such general obligation bonds shall not be issued until a resolution adopted by the Governing Body of the City stating the purpose for which such bonds are to be issued, the total amount of the bonds proposed to be issued, and the total cost to the City of issuing such refunding bonds, shall be published once in the official newspaper of the City. No such general obligation bonds shall be issued unless: 
(a)  The total cost to the City of issuing the general obligation bonds shall amount to less than the remaining interest cost to the municipality on the outstanding revenue bonds being refunded; 
(b)  The anticipated revenues from the City's combined water and sewage system involved are expected to be sufficient to retire such general obligation bonds; and 
(c)  The refunding is necessary to accomplish a comprehensive and orderly financing plan for the utility system. 
All such bonds, when registered and issued, as herein provided, shall import absolute verity and shall be conclusive in favor of all persons purchasing such bonds that all proceedings and conditions precedent have been had and performed to authorize the issuance thereof and such bonds shall be negotiable and may be issued in addition to the statutory limit of bonded indebtedness of the issuing City. Any City which has combined its water and sewage system may issue general obligation bonds for the improvement of such system in the same manner and subject to the same limitations as such City could issue if it had not combined the system." 
CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 25 

Section 1. - [Public improvements; amendment of Charter Ordinance No. 8; substitute and additional provisions.] 
    Pursuant to the constitution, the City of Pittsburg, Kansas, hereby amends its Charter Ordinance No. 8 and provides the following substitute and additional provisions on the same subject: 
"For the purpose of paying for any bridge, viaduct, sidewalk, public building, including land necessary therefor; for lands for public parks (including golf courses) and developing the same, within or without the City; for the improvement, repair or extension of any airport, waterworks system, sanitary and/or stormwater sewage disposal system, electric light plant, antenna and tower system or other public utility owned by the City; for the purpose of rebuilding, adding to or extending the same from time to time, as the necessities of the City may require; and for the acquisition of equipment for the construction, installation, maintenance and repair of such improvements, the City may borrow money and issue its general obligation bonds for the purpose of paying the costs of any of the equipment or improvements mentioned in this Section and the land necessary therefor." 
CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 26 
[Deleted-Repeals Charter Ordinance No. 23.] 
CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 27 
[Repealed by Charter Ordinance No. 29.] 
CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 28 

Section 1. - [Municipal courts; exemption from state constitution and state law provisions.] 
    The City of Pittsburg, Kansas, by the power vested in it by Article 12, Section 5 of the Constitution of the State of Kansas hereby elects to exempt itself and make inapplicable to it the provisions of K.S.A. 12-4113(g), 12-4202, 12-4203, 12-4204, 12-4205a and 12-4207, and any amendments thereto. Such referenced provisions are part of the Kansas Code of Procedure for Municipal Courts, an enactment of the legislature, which is applicable to the City of Pittsburg but not uniformly applicable to all cities. 
Section 2. - Definitions. 
a.  For the purposes of this Charter Ordinance, the term "City Officer" shall mean those individuals filling positions, designated as a City Officer position by the City Manager, and confirmed as a City Officer position by resolution of the Governing Body. Said City Officers shall have the authority to investigate violations of City ordinances, order compliance with those ordinances, and issue complaints and notices to appear, pursuant to the provisions hereof. 
b.  For the purposes of this Charter Ordinance, the term "complaint" means a sworn written statement, or a written statement by a law enforcement officer or a City Officer, of the essential facts constituting a violation of a City ordinance. 
Section 3. - Complaint; requirements; form. 
    A complaint shall be in writing and shall be signed by the complainant. More than one violation may be charged in the same complaint. A complaint shall be deemed sufficient if in substantially the following form: 
IN THE MUNICIPAL COURT OF 
PITTSBURG, KANSAS 
The City of Pittsburg, Kansas, 
vs. 
___________ (Accused person) 
___________, the undersigned, complains that on or about the ___ day of ________, 20___, in the City of Pittsburg, County of Crawford, and State of Kansas, ___________ did then and there unlawfully _____
_____
in violation of Section _____ of Ordinance No. _____ of the City of Pittsburg. 
Complainant 
*Sworn to positively before me, this ___ day of ________, 20___. 
Officer authorized to administer oaths 
(*This complaint is not required to be sworn if it is signed by a law enforcement officer or a City Officer.) 
    Whenever a Law Enforcement Officer or City Officer issues a complaint for the violation of any City ordinance, and such complaint includes information required by this Charter Ordinance, and is signed by the officer preparing the same, then such complaint shall be deemed lawful for purposes of prosecution under this Charter Ordinance, even though the same has not been sworn to before a Municipal Judge, Court Clerk, Assistant Court Clerk, or Notary Public. 
Section 4. - [Complaint and notice to appear-Combined form.] 
    In all cases a complaint and notice to appear in Municipal Court may be set forth on a combined form, which shall be deemed sufficient if it contains the information set forth in both Section 3 and Section 5 of this Charter Ordinance, and, where applicable, the information required by subsection (b) of K.S.A. 8-2106, and amendments thereto. 
Section 5. - Notice to appear; contents; form. 
    A notice to appear shall describe the offense charged, shall summon the accused person to appear, shall contain a space in which the accused person may agree, in writing, to appear at a time not less than five (5) days after such notice to appear is given, unless the accused person shall demand an earlier hearing. A notice to appear may be signed by a Municipal Judge, the Clerk of the Municipal Court, City Prosecutor, or any Law Enforcement Officer or City Officer. A notice to appear shall be deemed sufficient if in substantially the following form: 
IN THE MUNICIPAL COURT OF 
PITTSBURG, KANSAS 
The City of Pittsburg, Kansas 
vs. 
___________ (Accused person) 
(Address) 
NOTICE TO APPEAR 
The City of Pittsburg, Kansas, To the Above Named Accused Person. 
    You are hereby summoned to appear before the Municipal Court of Pittsburg, Kansas, on the ___ day of ________, 20___, at _____/_____/_____ o'clock, ___.m., to answer a complaint charging you with _____
_____
_____
_____ . 
If you fail to appear a warrant will be issued for your arrest. 
Dated ________, 20___. 
Signature of Official 
Title of Official 
I agree to appear in said Court at said time and place. 
Signature of Accused Person 
RETURN 
    The undersigned hereby certifies that on the _____ day of ________, 20___, the notice to appear was served, mailed or delivered. 
Law Enforcement Officer/City Officer 
Section 6. - Same-Service; return. 
    A copy of the complaint, together with the notice to appear shall be served upon the accused person by delivering a copy to him or her personally, or by leaving it at the dwelling house of the accused person or usual place of abode with some person of suitable age and discretion then residing therein, or by mailing to the last known address of said person. A copy of the complaint and the notice to appear may be served by any Law Enforcement Officer or City Officer and, if mailed, shall be mailed by a Law Enforcement Officer, City Officer, or the Clerk of the Municipal Court. Upon service by mail, the Law Enforcement Officer, City Officer or the Clerk of the Municipal Court shall execute a verification to be filed with a copy of the notice to appear. Said verification shall be deemed sufficient if in substantially the following form: 
    The undersigned hereby certifies that on the ___ day of ________, 20___, a copy of the complaint and a notice to appear was mailed to ___________ at 
_____ . 
Signature of Law Enforcement Officer/ 
City Officer/Clerk of Municipal Court 
Section 7. - Same-How used; issuance of warrant; refusal to issue; effect. 
    A copy of the complaint shall be served, together with a notice to appear or a warrant, by a Law Enforcement Officer or City Officer upon the accused person, and forthwith, the complaint shall be filed with the Municipal Court. A complaint may also be filed initially with the Municipal Court, and if so filed, a copy of the complaint shall forthwith be delivered to the City Prosecutor. The City Prosecutor shall cause a notice to appear to be issued, unless he or she has good reason to believe that the accused person will not appear in response to a notice to appear, in which case the City Prosecutor may request that a warrant be issued. Such warrant will be issued if the complaint is positively sworn to and the municipal judge has probable cause to believe that (a) there has been the commission of a violation of a municipal ordinance, (b) the accused person committed such violation and (c) the accused person will not appear in response to a notice to appear. 
    If the City Prosecutor fails to cause a notice to appear to be served, and also fails to request a warrant to be issued, on a complaint initially filed with the Municipal Court, the Municipal Judge may, upon affidavits filed with him or her alleging the violation of an ordinance, order the City Prosecutor to institute proceedings against the accused person. Any such Municipal Judge shall be disqualified from sitting in any case wherein such order was entered and is further prohibited from communicating about such case with the Municipal Judge Pro Tem appointed to preside therein. 
Section 8. - [Publication of ordinance.] 
    This ordinance shall be published once each week for two (2) consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper. 
Section 9. - [Effective date of ordinance.] 
    This Charter Ordinance shall take effect sixty-one (61) days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and the referendum held on the Ordinance as provided in Article 12, Section 5 of the Constitution of the State of Kansas, in which case this Charter Ordinance shall not take effect or become effective unless approved by a majority of the electors voting thereof. 
    PASSED by the Governing Body, not less than two-thirds ( 2/3 ) of the members-elect voting in favor thereof, this 26th day of June, 2012. 
CHARTER ORDINANCE NO. 29 

Section 1. - [Repeal of Charter Ordinance No. 27.] 
    The City of Pittsburg, Kansas hereby repeals Charter Ordinance No. 27. 
Section 2. - [Rate of levy for library.] 
    The Governing Body of the City of Pittsburg, Kansas shall not fix a rate of levy in any one year on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation of the city for the following named purpose in excess of the following rate: Library - 8.00 mills. 
Section 3. - [Publication of ordinance.] 
    This Charter Ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper. 
Section 4. - [Effective date of ordinance.] 
    This Charter Ordinance shall take effect sixty (60) days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and the referendum held on the Ordinance as provided in Article 12, Section 5 of the Constitution of the State of Kansas, in which case this Charter Ordinance shall not take effect or become effective unless approved by a majority of the electors voting thereof. 
    PASSED by the Governing Body, not less than two-third ( 2/3 ) of the members-elect voting in favor thereof, this 24th day of February, 2015.
